intro: Amblystigma hypoleucum, commonly known as the white-flowered amblystigma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, upright stems with narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Amblystigma hypoleucum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
